Title: The effects of eWOM valence and absence on consumers’ trust, brand attitudes, and purchase intentions.
Keywords: eWOM, valence, absence, brand trust, brand attitude, purchase intention, YouTube
Research_Goal: To investigate the effects of eWOM valence and absence on consumers’ brand trust, brand attitude, and purchase intention.
Research_Question: What are the effects for eWOM valence (positive and negative) and eWOM absence (non-referential and disabled) on consumers’ brand attitude and purchase intentions, and does consumers’ perceived trust mediate this relationship?
Hypotheses: H1a: eWOM valence (positive eWOM and negative eWOM) of comments underneath YouTube brand content influences brand attitude and purchase intention.; H1b: eWOM absence (i.e. disabled UGSMC) underneath YouTube brand content influences brand attitude and purchase intention.; H1c: eWOM absence (i.e. non-referential UGSMC) underneath YouTube brand content influences brand attitude and purchase intention.; H2: Consumers’ perceived trust mediates the relationship of eWOM valence and absence with brand attitude, and purchase intention.
Methodology: An online experiment with a 1 x 4 between-subjects design was conducted, involving 207 participants. The study tested the effects of eWOM valence (positive and negative) and eWOM absence (non-referential and disabled) on brand trust, brand attitude, and purchase intention.
Findings_Summary: The study found that disabling the comment section is beneficial when negative eWOM is anticipated but not when positive eWOM is anticipated. Trust mediated the relationship between eWOM absence and valence with brand attitude and purchase intention.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Future research should allow full interactivity whilst controlling for social media experience or incorporating social media experience as a moderator.', 'Future research should incorporate non-referential UGSMC valence (positive, neutral, and negative) and compare it with eWOM valence as well as with disabled UGSMC.', 'Future research can be enriched by comparing eWOM absence and valence on dynamic and rich media versus on static and lean media in one singular study.', 'Future research should employ a within-subjects design which tests the impact of disabling the comment section after positive and negative eWOM has already been read by users.']
Author: Cedric Bratzke

Title: Risicofactoren van fysieke kindermishandeling: Een meta-analytisch overzicht
Keywords: fysieke kindermishandeling, risicofactoren, meta-analyse
Research_Goal: Het actualiseren van de huidige kennis over het effect van risicofactoren op fysieke kindermishandeling.
Research_Question: Welke risicofactoren hebben invloed op fysieke kindermishandeling en hoe worden deze effecten gemodereerd?
Hypotheses: not present
Methodology: Een meta-analyse werd uitgevoerd over 40 studies die totaal over 365 effectgroottes rapporteerden. Een drie-level model werd gebruikt voor het berekenen van de gemiddelde effectgroottes per risicodomein en voor het uitvoeren van de moderatoranalyses.
Findings_Summary: Kleine tot groot-gemiddelde significante effectgroottes werden gevonden voor zestien risicodomeinen. De vijf grootste gemiddelde effectgroottes werden gevonden voor de domeinen ‘geschiedenis van antisociaal gedrag door de ouders’, ‘ouderlijke stress’, ‘disfunctionele overtuigingen, normen en waarden van de ouders’, ‘eerdere of huidige vormen van kindermishandeling’ en ‘kind heeft periode niet bij gezin gewoond’.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Meer onderzoek is nodig naar de tot op heden weinig onderzochte risicofactoren die in huidige meta-analyse als belangrijkste risicofactoren naar voren zijn gekomen.']

Title: Between evidence and ethics: A qualitative study of evidence-informed policymaking on unequal educational opportunities in the Netherlands
Keywords: evidence-based policy, political epistemology, educational inequalities, social justice
Research_Goal: to enhance our understanding of the role of research evidence in the policy process both practically and normatively
Research_Question: How is knowledge about unequal educational opportunities created and mobilized for national policy in the Netherlands?
Hypotheses: not present
Methodology: The study uses qualitative research methods, including twelve semi-structured interviews with policymakers, advisors, and researchers, fieldnotes from one event, and analysis of nine research-advisory reports and policy documents. It employs interpretive policy analysis.
Findings_Summary: The findings reveal a complex relationship between evidence-informed policymaking and the contents of educational policies, highlighting that the process often overlooks social factors and oversimplifies issues, while many participants advocate for a stronger relationship between research and policy.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Investigate the co-production of policy knowledge by different actors.', 'Explore the implications of lacking ethical reflection within policy.']

Title: 21st-Century Bamboo Diplomacy: Investigating the Dynamics of Deploying Foreign Policies through the Logistics Infrastructure Projects on Thailand’s Kra Isthmus
Keywords: bamboo diplomacy, foreign policy, logistics infrastructure, Kra Isthmus, geopolitical importance
Research_Goal: to provide a nuanced examination of the projects’ geopolitical importance, particularly regarding foreign policy, within the framework of practical geopolitics
Research_Question: How have the infrastructure projects on the Kra Isthmus been instrumentalised by the Thai government in deploying bamboo diplomacy throughout the two governments?
Hypotheses: The geopolitical discourses from the foreign stakeholder nations toward Kra Isthmus changed throughout the two governments.; The Thai governments reacted to the situations of that time through the infrastructure project plans on the Kra Isthmus.; The changing forms of infrastructure projects, from the Thai Canal to the Land Bridge, shaped the deployment of bamboo diplomacy throughout the two governments.
Methodology: This study employs a longitudinal discourse analysis of published interviews, documents, and media, focusing on the dynamics of deploying bamboo diplomacy through infrastructure projects on the Kra Isthmus.
Findings_Summary: The findings indicate that the projects reflect Thailand's adaptability in foreign policy, balancing economic opportunities with geopolitical stability, particularly in the context of relations with China and India.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Explore the environmental and social impacts of the Land Bridge projects.', 'Conduct comparative studies on foreign policy strategies in other Southeast Asian infrastructure projects.', 'Assess the economic impact on local communities and regional trade.', 'Examine how these projects shaped discourses and practices using theories like assemblage.']

Title: Navigating Border Violence: An In-Depth Analysis of Humanitarian Efforts along the Bosnian-Croatian Border
Keywords: Migrant Crisis, Border Violence, Humanitarianism, Human Rights, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia
Research_Goal: To research the intense humanitarian activity at the Bosnian-Croatian border characterised by border violence and the infringement of fundamental human rights.
Research_Question: How do locals and NGOs navigate the challenges posed by border violence in their humanitarian efforts along the north-western Bosnian-Croatian border?
Hypotheses: Border violence is still prevalent in the borderscape between the city of Bihać and Velika Kladuša.; The experiences of locals and NGOs in navigating border violence are complex and multifaceted.
Methodology: The study employs qualitative research methods, including observations and semi-structured interviews with locals, NGO representatives, and migrants. Thematic analysis is used to identify and report themes within the data.
Findings_Summary: The research confirms that border violence remains pervasive, with physical, psychological, and systemic violence reported by migrants. Local and NGO responses demonstrate adaptability and resilience, but systemic failures persist.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Conduct comparative analyses with other border regions experiencing similar crises.', 'Investigate the long-term impacts of humanitarian aid on local communities and migrants.']

Author: Špela Lovrenčič

Title: The Best Laid Masterplans: Development, Community Organisational Networks, and Amenities in Amsterdam Zuidoost
Keywords: community-based organisations, local amenities, neighbourhood organisational networks, Amsterdam Zuidoost, participatory development
Research_Goal: to explore the relationship between community-based organisations (CBOs) and their proximity to local amenities within the neighbourhood organisational networks of two neighbourhoods in Amsterdam Zuid Oost
Research_Question: Does the greater presence of amenities in a neighbourhood increase the size and influence of the community organisational network and its CBOs?
Hypotheses: Neighbourhoods in Zuidoost with few amenities will have a less dense network of CBOs, with lower centrality scores than neighbourhoods with many.; There is a negative correlation between increased distance of ‘meeting’ amenities from community organisations and the centrality scores of these in the neighbourhood organisational network.; There is a negative, but weaker than that for ‘meeting’ amenities, correlation between increased distance of ‘dynamic’ amenities from community organisations and the centrality scores of these in the neighbourhood organisational network.
Methodology: This research employs a mixed-methods approach, including qualitative interviews, social network analysis (SNA), and regression analysis. It uses a most-similar comparative design to compare two neighbourhoods, Venserpolder and Reigersbos, in Amsterdam Zuidoost.
Findings_Summary: The study finds that Venserpolder struggles with low social participation and community cohesion due to a lack of amenities, while Reigersbos shows a vibrant community network with better access to amenities. The presence of meeting amenities is significantly linked to the centrality of community organisations.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Further expansive research to validate the findings and provide more definitive evidence on the relationship between amenity proximity and organisational network centrality.', 'Investigate the impact of building style on social participation in Venserpolder.', 'Explore the effects of the nearby Amsterdamse Poort on community dynamics in Venserpolder.']
Author: Hector Steenbergen-Cockerton

Title: Homestay Practices and The Homes for Ukraine Scheme: An examination of domesticated responsibility and exceptional hospitality
Keywords: Hospitality, Responsibility and Care, Deservingness, Temporariness, Homestay Practices, Homes for Ukraine
Research_Goal: To examine the Homes for Ukraine scheme as a model for welcoming newcomers and to critically consider individual and collective responsibility to show hospitality.
Research_Question: How could homestay practices, as seen in the UK’s homes for Ukraine scheme, make us reconsider our individual and collective responsibility to show hospitality to newcomers?
Hypotheses: The HFU scheme could prompt both state and society to consider showing greater responsibility and hospitality to newcomers.; The hospitality extended to Ukrainians under the HFU scheme is influenced by identity-based discourses of deservingness.
Methodology: The study employs a qualitative approach, utilizing in-depth interviews with hosts, guests, and charity representatives, alongside document analysis of parliamentary debates and existing research reports.
Findings_Summary: The findings indicate that while the HFU scheme facilitated significant private hospitality, it also placed considerable burdens on hosts and guests, revealing the need for more robust state support and long-term solutions.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Conduct comparative studies on the Afghan resettlement scheme and other hosting programs.', 'Examine the onward trajectories of Ukrainian newcomers to assess their integration and contributions.', 'Investigate the racialized and gendered aspects of hospitality and deservingness in migration policies.']

Title: Performing Ecological Restoration: A multispecies ethnography of the Marker Wadden project
Keywords: ecological restoration, multispecies ethnography, Marker Wadden, biodiversity, nature conservation
Research_Goal: to elucidate how human actors of the Marker Wadden project relate to lively other-than-human beings in their ecological restoration practices

Findings_Summary: The research found that different practices of ecological restoration performed by human actors afford care to other-than-humans in varied ways, revealing a complex interplay between design, management, and ecological dynamics.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Further studies could explore the long-term ecological impacts of the Marker Wadden project.', 'Investigate the socio-political dynamics influencing ecological restoration practices.']

Title: Standing Out from the Crowd Through Employer Branding: The Key to Successfully Attract Talents of Generation Z
Keywords: employer branding, job advertisements, recruitment communication, instrumental-symbolic framework, signaling theory, organizational reputation, P-O fit, employer attractiveness, intention to apply
Research_Goal: to investigate to what extent instrumental and symbolic EB elements influence employer attractiveness as perceived by potential employees of Generation Z
Research_Question: To what extent do instrumental and symbolic EB elements in job advertisements influence employer attractiveness as perceived by potential employees of Generation Z, and what role does OR play in this context?
Hypotheses: H1a: Communicating instrumental and symbolic EB elements in job advertisements leads to higher employer attractiveness than communicating only instrumental EB elements.; H1b: Communicating instrumental EB elements in job advertisements leads to higher employer attractiveness than communicating no EB elements.; H2: Organizations with a positive reputation are perceived as more attractive employers than organizations with a negative reputation.; H3a: Communicating instrumental and symbolic EB elements in job advertisements leads to higher employer attractiveness than communicating only instrumental EB elements, and this effect is stronger when OR is negative than when OR is positive.; H3b: Communicating instrumental EB elements in job advertisements leads to higher employer attractiveness than communicating no EB elements, and this effect is stronger when OR is negative than when OR is positive.; Title: All You Can Eat, Just Order the Meat

Participants were randomly assigned to one of four conditions and asked to choose between default and alternative menu options.
Findings_Summary: The study found that presenting a vegetarian default menu increased vegetarian choice from 21% to 52%. The default effect was confirmed, but contrary to expectations, higher effort to switch to the alternative option slightly increased the likelihood of choosing it.

Title: Spelling of Children in Grade 4: Explicit Rules or Implicit Cues?

Title: The influence of treatment dosage on effects of a spelling intervention for students with and without dyslexia: A moderated mediation model

Research_Goal: To investigate the effectiveness of a spelling intervention for verb inflection and visual imprint words and the influence of dosage variables.

Title: The role of selectivity exposure in information seeking about COVID-19 vaccination and adopting preventive behaviors

Hypotheses: H1: The belief someone has is congruent with the search strategy someone uses to seek information about the COVID-19 vaccination.; H2: There is a relationship between the beliefs someone has and the behavior he or she performs.; H2a: More particularly, there is a positive relation between the belief towards vaccination and getting vaccinated.; H2b: More particularly, there is a positive relation between the belief towards precautions and adhering to the precautions.; H3: The relation between beliefs and behavior is moderated by the search strategy someone uses.; H3a: More specifically, the effect of someone’s belief towards vaccination is stronger on their vaccination behavior if their search strategy is congruent with their belief towards vaccination.; H3b: More specifically, the effect of someone’s belief towards precautions is stronger on their behavior of adhering to the precautions if their search strategy is congruent with their belief towards precautions.
Methodology: A representative sample of 230 Dutch people were surveyed using convenience and snowball sampling. Data collection commenced on April 22nd 2021 and ended on May 3rd 2021. Findings_Summary: The findings show that the search strategy a person uses to collect information online regarding the vaccine against COVID-19 is not of influence on the choice a person will make based on his or her beliefs. 79.4% of the participants reported that they will get vaccinated against COVID-19. Research_Goal: Het doel van deze studie was om meer inzicht te verkrijgen in de sterkte van het verband tussen kindermishandeling en suïcidaal gedrag en te onderzoeken welke modererende factoren mogelijk invloed hebben op dit verband.
Research_Question: Is er bij slachtoffers van kindermishandeling vaker sprake van suïcidaal gedrag dan bij niet-slachtoffers en hoe sterk is dit verband? Welke factoren zijn van invloed op de relatie tussen slachtofferschap van kindermishandeling en suïcidaal gedrag, zoals type kindermishandeling, vorm van suïcidaal gedrag, geslacht, leeftijd en etniciteit?
Hypotheses: Er werd verwacht dat er bij slachtoffers van kindermishandeling vaker sprake was van suïcidaal gedrag dan bij niet-slachtoffers en dat dit een sterk verband zou zijn.; Verder werd verwacht dat seksueel misbruik de grootste impact heeft en dat bij deze slachtoffers vaker sprake is van suïcidaal gedrag dan bij slachtoffers van andere vormen van kindermishandeling.; Daarnaast werd verwacht dat het effect van slachtofferschap van kindermishandeling op suïcidaal gedrag ongeveer even groot was voor meisjes en voor jongens.; Ook werd verwacht dat het effect van slachtofferschap van kindermishandeling op suïcidaal gedrag groter was wanneer het kind op jongere leeftijd werd mishandeld.; Als laatste werd verwacht dat het effect van slachtofferschap van kindermishandeling op suïcidaal gedrag minder groot was wanneer het kind een niet-westerse afkomst had.
Methodology: Een drie-level meta-analyse werd uitgevoerd, waarbij gebruik werd gemaakt van zowel prospectieve als retrospectieve studies, en zowel longitudinale als cross-sectionele data. Inclusiecriteria omvatten studies die het verband tussen kindermishandeling en suïcidaal gedrag onderzochten en statistieken rapporteerden over dit verband.
Findings_Summary: Er werd een significant overall effect gevonden van kindermishandeling op suïcidaal gedrag (*r* = .22). Slachtoffers van kindermishandeling laten vaker suïcidaal gedrag zien dan niet-slachtoffers. De vorm van kindermishandeling en de vorm van suïcidaal gedrag bleken significante moderatoren te zijn.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Vervolgonderzoek zou kunnen kijken naar andere factoren die het verband tussen kindermishandeling en suïcidaal gedrag kunnen beïnvloeden.', 'Het is relevant om in vervolgonderzoek te onderzoeken welke hulp noodzakelijk is om de gevolgen van kindermishandeling zoveel mogelijk te beperken en daarmee het risico op suïcidaal gedrag te verminderen.', 'Er kan in vervolgonderzoek meer gekeken worden naar covariaten, om meer kennis te verkrijgen over factoren die van invloed zijn op het verband tussen kindermishandeling en de gevolgen daarvan.']

Title: The Effect of Gender Nonconformity on Internalizing Problems Through Homophobic and Gender Nonconforming Name-Calling
Keywords: gender nonconformity, internalizing problems, homophobic name-calling, gender nonconforming name-calling, adolescents
Research_Goal: to examine the long-term effect of gender nonconformity among Dutch adolescents on internalizing problem behaviour via homophobic and gender nonconformity name-calling
Research_Question: Is the association between adolescents’ level of gender nonconformity associated with internalizing problems through homophobic and gender nonconforming name-calling?
Hypotheses: The hypothesis is that the adolescents’ gender nonconformity at the beginning of their school career at a secondary school is associated with internalizing problem behaviour later in their school career, through experiences with homophobic and gender nonconforming name-calling.
Methodology: The study used a longitudinal dataset with data collected from 1152 adolescents in the Netherlands. A questionnaire was administered to measure gender nonconformity, homophobic and gender nonconforming name-calling, and internalizing problem behaviour at different time points.
Findings_Summary: Results showed that both gender nonconforming and homophobic name-calling did not explain the effect of gender nonconformity on internalizing problems, contradicting the hypothesis. However, adolescents reporting higher on gender nonconformity did show more internalizing problems.

Title: Wat is er bekend over de effectiviteit van de uitgevoerde sancties en maatregelen bij jeugdige daders van ernstige geweldsmisdrijven, in het bijzonder met betrekking tot resocialisatie?

Research_Goal: To investigate how German journalists perceive and enact their professional roles when reporting on the populist right-wing party AfD and how they respond to the party’s instrumentalization attempts.
Research_Question: ['How do German journalists perceive their roles when reporting on issues related to the AfD (Alternative for Germany)?', 'How do German journalists enact their roles when reporting on issues related to the AfD (Alternative for Germany)?', 'Are there differences between the role perceptions and role enactments of German journalists when reporting on issues related to the AfD (Alternative for Germany)?', 'How aware are German journalists about AfD instrumentalization techniques and how do they respond to this phenomenon?']

Methodology: Qualitative method of semi-structured expert interviews with eight political journalists from seven different German newspapers. The interviews were conducted over two months and analyzed using a mixed methodology of deductive and inductive coding.

Title: Van Handhaving tot Handreiking: Verschillende Perspectieven op Burgerschap van Roma
Keywords: burgerschap, Roma, onderwijs, stigma, beleid, identificatie, transnationaal burgerschap
Research_Goal: Bijdragen aan een oplossing voor de moeilijkheden waar zowel Roma als beleidsmakers en politici tegenaan lopen.
Research_Question: In hoeverre is de conceptualisering van burgerschap in beleidsstukken van de nationale Nederlandse overheid rondom onderwijs van Roma verschoven van formeel naar moreel dan wel transnationaal burgerschap?
Hypotheses: not present
Methodology: De studie is gebaseerd op een inhoudelijke analyse van beleidsdocumenten, Kamerstukken en Kamervragen van de nationale Nederlandse overheid vanaf 1992, met een focus op de onderwijspositie van Roma. Er is gebruik gemaakt van kwalitatieve methoden, waaronder discoursanalyse en thematische codering.
Findings_Summary: Er is een verschuiving in de conceptualisering van burgerschap waargenomen, waarbij de overheid steeds meer de nadruk legt op de culturele achtergrond van Roma en de noodzaak voor integratie. Dit heeft geleid tot een tweeslachtigheid in het beleid, waarbij enerzijds generiek beleid wordt gevoerd en anderzijds specifieke maatregelen voor Roma worden genomen.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Onderzoek hoe het geformuleerde beleid in 2019, 2020 en 2021 uitpakt binnen het generiek beleid.', 'Vergelijkingen maken met landen waar geen generiek beleid of waar wel generiek beleid wordt gevoerd.']

Title: Influencing sexual health perceptions and behavioural intentions through Instagram
Keywords: Instagram, sexual suggestiveness, social norms, descriptive norms, injunctive norms, sexual health, perception, behavioural intentions, sexual risk behaviour
Research_Goal: to determine whether sexually suggestive content on Instagram influences the perception and intended behaviour regarding sexual risks among young adults
Research_Question: How does the type of image (sexually suggestive vs not sexually suggestive) on Instagram influence young adults' perception of sexual health and how does it influence their sexual health behavioural intentions, and is this effect moderated by the inclusion of a social norms message?
Hypotheses: H1a: Sexually suggestive Instagram posts will increase the perception of sexually risky behaviour among young adults compared to Instagram posts that are not sexually suggestive.; H1b: Sexually suggestive Instagram posts will increase sexually risky behaviour intentions among young adults compared to Instagram posts that are not sexually suggestive.; H2a: Including a descriptive norm within an Instagram post will strengthen the effect of a sexually suggestive picture on the perception of sexual health and sexual health behaviour intentions among young adults.; H2b: Including an injunctive norm within an Instagram post will strengthen the effect of a sexually suggestive picture on the perception of sexual health and sexual health behaviour intentions among young adults.
Methodology: This study takes a quantitative approach using a 2x3 between-subject factorial survey experiment design. An online experiment was conducted where participants were randomly assigned to one of six conditions manipulating the image (sexually suggestive vs. not sexually suggestive) and the caption (injunctive norm, descriptive norm, or control condition).
Findings_Summary: No significant effect of sexually suggestive images was found on perception or behavioural intention. Additionally, no significant effect was found regarding the moderation effect through the inclusion of a descriptive or injunctive norm.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Future research could focus on the importance of who is conveying the message.', 'Gaining more insight into social networking sites could provide a new platform through which accurate sexual health information can be shared with hard to reach target audiences.']

Title: De Relatie tussen Mind-Mindedness van Ouders en de Theory of Mind van Kinderen
Keywords: mind-mindedness, Theory of Mind, moeders, vaders, mentaliseren, kindertijd
Research_Goal: onderzoek te doen naar de relatie tussen vaderlijke en moederlijke mind-mindedness en de ToM van het 7.5-jarige kind, het mogelijke gecombineerde effect van ouderlijke mind-mindedness en het verkennen van de relatie tussen de positieve en negatieve emotionele classificaties van mind-mindedness en de ToM van het 7.5-jarige kind
Research_Question: Wat is de relatie tussen ouderlijke mind-mindedness en de Theory of Mind van kinderen op zevenenhalfjarige leeftijd?
Hypotheses: Dat zowel de mind-mindedness van moeders als van vaders een positief effect kan hebben op de ToM ontwikkeling van kinderen op zevenenhalf jaar.; Dat ouders door middel van mind-mindedness een even groot effect zouden kunnen hebben op de ToM ontwikkeling van kinderen op zevenenhalf jaar.; Een gecombineerd effect te vinden van de mind-mindedness van ouders samen, waarbij moeders meer mind-mindedness tonen wanneer vaders dit minder doen, en andersom.
Methodology: Huidig onderzoek betreft een onderdeel van een groter longitudinaal onderzoek aan de Universiteit van Amsterdam. Participanten zijn 151 Nederlandse eerstgeborenen en hun ouders, waarbij de mind-mindedness en ToM zijn gemeten op 7.5 jaar. De mind-mindedness werd gemeten met een interview en de ToM met de ToM test-R.
Findings_Summary: De resultaten tonen aan dat hoe meer ouders mind-mindedness gebruiken, hoe beter de ToM van het zevenenhalfjarige kind ontwikkeld bleek. De positieve en negatieve emotionele lading van mind-mindedness van beide ouders bleek niet gerelateerd aan de ToM van het kind.

Title: When do we stop tolerating an intolerant society?

Title: Designing Sustainable Consumption
Keywords: sustainable design, E-grocery, environmental nudging, choice architecture, response efficacy beliefs, sustainable shopping
Research_Goal: to examine the impact of environmental nudging (positive & negative) and choice architecture on sustainable shopping behaviour
Research_Question: To what extent do environmental nudging approaches (positive vs. negative vs. absent) and choice architecture (present vs. absent) in E-grocery apps influence sustainable shopping behaviour in the user? Is this relationship mediated by response efficacy beliefs?
Hypotheses: H1: Positive environmental nudging (ECO-based) in E-grocery apps results in more sustainable shopping behaviour when compared to no-nudging, but in less sustainable shopping behaviour when compared to negative environmental nudging (CO2-based).; H2: Present choice architecture in E-grocery apps results in more sustainable shopping behaviour when compared to absent choice architecture.; H3: Present choice architecture combined with environmental nudging (either positive or negative) in E-grocery apps results in more sustainable shopping behaviour when compared to either choice architecture or environmental nudging (either positive or negative) alone.; H4: The effect of sustainable design strategies (environmental nudging & choice architecture) on sustainable shopping behaviour is mediated via response efficacy beliefs.
Methodology: The study employed a 3x2 between-subject factorial design with 287 participants, using a self-reported web-based questionnaire. Participants were randomly assigned to one of six experimental conditions to test the effects of environmental nudging and choice architecture on sustainable shopping behaviour.
Findings_Summary: Results showed that both environmental nudging and choice architecture increase sustainable shopping behaviour in consumers. However, the interaction of both variables did not show significant results, and no mediation effect was found in the model.

Title: Effects of Persuasive Strategies and Message Fatigue on Counterarguing
Keywords: message fatigue, counterarguing, resistance, persuasive strategies, public health
Research_Goal: To determine whether omega strategies are more effective at decreasing counterarguing than alpha strategies, and whether this is especially true when levels of message fatigue are high.
Research_Question: To which extent do omega strategies (vs. alpha strategies and a control message) influence counterarguing, and is this effect moderated by message fatigue?
Hypotheses: H1: No message strategy will lead to less counterarguing among message receivers than when an omega strategy or an alpha strategy is used.; H2: The participants in the omega strategy condition will experience less counterarguing than message receivers in the alpha strategy condition.; H3a: If the level of message fatigue experienced by the receiver is high, this will increase the level of counterarguing caused by the persuasive message strategy. The moderating effect of message fatigue will be significantly stronger in the alpha condition than in the omega condition.; H3b: If the level of message fatigue experienced by the receiver is low, this will decrease the level of counterarguing caused by the persuasive message, for both omega and alpha conditions.
Methodology: A between-subjects 3 x 2 experiment was conducted with 243 participants. The independent variable was message strategy (alpha, omega, control) and the moderator was message fatigue (low, high). Data was collected through an online survey.
Findings_Summary: The results showed that the persuasive conditions led to significantly different levels of counterarguing than the descriptive control message, but in the opposite direction as predicted. The use of omega strategies did not have a significant effect on counterarguing compared to alpha strategies.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Studying omega strategies in the context of topics that are known to cause resistance, such as vaccination campaigns.', 'Examining the effects of message explicitness, in contrast to omega and alpha strategies, to see if this factor explains how persuasive messages influence counterarguing.', 'Further studies on the role of message fatigue and reactance.']

Title: Health warnings in unhealthy food commercials in the war on obesity, a silver bullet or unnecessary regulation?
Keywords: health warnings, unhealthy food commercials, eating intention, dietary restraint, obesity
Research_Goal: to explore the possibility of adding a health warning in unhealthy food commercials to combat overweight and obesity in adults
Research_Question: To what extent do health warnings (none, before, after) in video commercials for unhealthy food influence eating intentions, and how does dietary restraint (unrestrained, restrained) influence this relation?
Hypotheses: H1: Either seeing a health warning before or after a food commercial will decrease the intention to consume the product compared to the condition without a health warning.; H2: A health warning at the beginning of the commercial will have a more negative effect on the intention to consume the product compared to a health warning after the commercial and to a higher extent the no health warning condition.; H3: The health warning will decrease the intention to consume the product more for restrained eaters compared to unrestrained eaters compared to the control condition without a health warning.
Methodology: The study used a 3 (no health warning, before, after) X 2 (restrained, unrestrained) between-subjects design in an online experiment with a total sample of 189 participants. Data was collected via a survey on Qualtrics, and eating intentions were measured through two questions.
Findings_Summary: The outcomes of the research were not as expected. Participants who saw a health warning did not have a significantly lower eating intention than the group who did not see a health warning. The moderating role of dietary restraint also did not have a significant effect.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Conduct future research on a lower educated sample with a higher BMI.', 'Include more participants and multiple exposures to health warnings.', 'Explore the effects of repeated exposure to health warnings on eating intentions.']

Title: Going with the flow: The effects of VR gaming on spatial presence, flow, and positive emotions
Keywords: video games, virtual reality, positive emotions, spatial presence, flow
Research_Goal: to investigate the underlying mechanisms of experiencing positive emotions in VR games
Research_Question: To what extent does VR gaming vs desktop gaming influence experiencing positive emotions in adults? To what extent is this effect mediated by spatial presence and flow?
Hypotheses: H1: VR gaming will lead to experiencing a higher level of positive emotions than desktop gaming.; H2: VR gaming will lead to a higher level of spatial presence than desktop gaming.; H3: A higher level of spatial presence will lead to experiencing more positive emotions.; H4: VR gaming will lead to a higher level of flow than desktop gaming.; H5: A higher level of flow will be related to higher positive emotions.; H6: A higher level of spatial presence relates to a higher feeling of flow.; H7: Spatial presence and flow positively mediate the effect of VR gaming on positive emotions.
Methodology: This experimental lab study involved 68 university students randomly assigned to play a game in either VR or desktop mode for 25 minutes, followed by a questionnaire assessing positive emotions, spatial presence, and flow. The study utilized a two-group experimental design with mediation analysis.
Findings_Summary: VR gaming did not lead to an increase in positive emotions directly. However, the effect of VR gaming on positive emotions was serial mediated through spatial presence and flow. VR gaming led to higher spatial presence, which was related to higher feelings of flow, subsequently predicting a higher level of positive emotions.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Future research should use VR headsets that offer adjustable IPD ranges such as the Oculus Quest 2.', 'Game developers should consider the biological differences between males and females and design products suitable for all genders.', 'Future studies should recruit a more balanced sample in terms of gender and age.']

Title: “Nasty” Women and “Deplorable” Men in Politics: A Content Analysis of the Online News Coverage of the 2016 United States Presidential Election.
Keywords: gender-bias, gender-news frames, gender-based disinformation, online news coverage, 2016 US presidential election
Research_Goal: to identify how gender-based disinformation strategies are employed in political news coverage to delegitimize the image of women politicians

Methodology: The study employed a quantitative content analysis of online news articles from CNN and Fox News, focusing on the presence of gender-based disinformation tactics. The sample consisted of 297 articles collected through random sampling, analyzing both textual and visual content.

Research_Question: How do cisgender and queer people navigate sex/gender segregated public bathrooms in the Netherlands?
Hypotheses: Cisgender and queer people navigate sex/gender segregated public bathroom facilities and design in the Netherlands.; Cisgender and queer people do and police sex/gender in gender segregated public bathrooms in the Netherlands.; Cisgender and queer people navigate the public bathroom debate.
Methodology: The study employed a qualitative methodology using semi-structured interviews with 14 participants, including cisgendered women, men, and genderqueer, trans, non-binary, and genderfluid individuals. Thematic analysis was used to analyze the data.
Findings_Summary: The findings revealed that public bathrooms are sites of gendered inequalities and that experiences vary significantly between cisgender and non-cisgender individuals. The research highlighted the complexities of navigating gendered spaces and the emotional burdens faced by non-normatively gendered individuals.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Further examine how the Dutch paradox of tolerance becomes foregrounded in the public bathroom space.', 'Investigate classed, raced, and ableist inequalities in intersection with gendered inequalities of the public bathroom space.']

Title: Technological Advancements in Online Advertising: Exploring the Effects of AR try-on Filters on Different Platforms in Relation to Self-Esteem
Keywords: AR try-on filters, purchase intention, brand attitude, self-esteem
Research_Goal: to investigate the effect of the presence of AR try-on filters in product presentation on brand attitude and purchase intention, and the different effects such filters have on different platforms for consumers with different levels of self-esteem
Research_Question: to what extent do AR try-on filters in different contexts affect attitude towards the brand and purchase intention, and whether this effect is moderated by self-esteem
Hypotheses: H1a: Product presentation with AR try-on filters leads to higher attitude towards the brand than product presentation without AR try-on filters.; H1b: Product presentation with AR try-on filters leads to higher purchase intention than product presentation without AR try-on filters.; H2a: The positive effect of AR try-on filters on attitude towards the brand compared to no AR try-on filters will be higher for consumers with higher levels of self-esteem than for consumers with lower levels of self-esteem.; H2b: The positive effect of AR try-on filters on purchase intention compared to no AR try-on filters will be higher for consumers with higher levels of self-esteem than for consumers with lower levels of self-esteem.; H3a: For people with low self-esteem, the online shop AR try-on filter will lead to higher attitude towards the brand than the Instagram AR try-on filter.; H3b: For people with low self-esteem, the online shop AR try-on filter will lead to higher purchase intention than the Instagram AR try-on filter.; H4a: For people with high self-esteem, the Instagram AR try-on filter will lead to higher attitude towards the brand than the online shop AR try-on filter.; H4b: For people with high self-esteem, the Instagram AR try-on filter will lead to higher purchase intention than the online shop AR try-on filter.
Methodology: The study employed a 3 (Instagram AR try-on filter vs. online shop AR try-on filter vs. control) x 2 (high vs. low self-esteem) between-subjects quasi-experiment with a sample of 300 participants gathered through convenience and snowball sampling.
Findings_Summary: The results showed no significant effects of presence of AR try-on filters in product presentation on brand attitude or purchase intention, and no significant interaction effects of self-esteem and presence of AR try-on filters.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Future research should tackle the issue with the use of a different, less popular brand, so to increase validity of the results.', 'Measuring brand attitude and purchase intention not only after, but also before the participants are exposed to the stimuli, would enable to exclude that the high scores on the dependent variables were due to the mere exposure to the product presentations.', 'Future research is advised to use a different scale and measure body-image rather than self-esteem as moderator of the effects of AR try-on filters on brand attitude and purchase intention of apparel products.', 'Future research should use consistent stimuli over each condition and groups of comparable sizes.']

Title: Mind-Mindedness van Vaders en Moeders: Ouderlijke Verschillen tijdens het Zevende Levensjaar van hun Kind
Keywords: mind-mindedness, ouders, vaders, moeders, interactie, kinderen, gehechtheid
Research_Goal: Het doel van huidig onderzoek is om bij te dragen aan het bestaande onderzoek door meer empirische evidentie te vergaren over de ouderlijke verschillen in interactionele mind-mindedness.
Research_Question: Wat zijn de verschillen van interactionele mind-mindedness tussen vaders en moeders bij hun kind op zevenjarige leeftijd?
Hypotheses: Vaders en moeders zullen geen significante verschillen vertonen in de totale mate van interactionele mind-mindedness.; Moeders zullen significant hoger scoren op mind-minded opmerkingen over wensen en emoties dan vaders.
Methodology: De studie was onderdeel van een longitudinaal onderzoek. 86 gezinnen werden gefilmd tijdens twee taken: een conflict bespreken en een vakantie plannen. De video-opnames werden getranscribeerd en gecodeerd volgens het protocol van Meins en Fernyhough (2015).
Findings_Summary: Moeders vertoonden over het algemeen meer interactionele mind-mindedness dan vaders. In de conflictsituatie maakten moeders significant meer mind-minded uitspraken dan vaders, maar in de vakantiesituatie was er geen significant verschil.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['De individuele vaardigheden van interactionele mind-mindedness van vaders en moeders in een setting apart van elkaar te analyseren.', 'Een longitudinaal onderzoeksdesign voor interactionele mind-mindedness van ouders bij hun kinderen in de latere kindertijd.']

Research_Goal: to explore and describe Dutch housing and hopefully serve as a starting point from which more in-depth research can be based
Research_Question: to what extent can small and flexible living alleviate some of the pressure that the current housing market finds itself under?
Hypotheses: not present
Methodology: The study uses data from Woononderzoek 2021, a national housing survey in the Netherlands, and employs qualitative analysis to examine the consequences of the Dutch government's strategy on housing supply.

Research_Goal: To emphasize the social side of environmental identity to understand how non-EU work migrants co-mingle with other cultures and perceive change to their environmental identity.

Title: HOW TO LOVE 101: HETERSEXUAL YOUNG DUTCH MEN THEIR EXPERIENCES OF MEDIATED AND EVERYDAY LOVE, ROMANCE AND ROMANTIC GENDER ROLES
Keywords: romantic movies, heteronormativity, gender roles, romantic ideals, love, relationships
Research_Goal: to analyze how heterosexual young Dutch men experience mediated portrayals of love, romance, romantic relationships and romantic gender roles and how they relate these to their real-life romantic experiences and vice versa
Research_Question: What are the experiences of heterosexual Dutch young men regarding mediated- and everyday love, romance, and romantic gender roles, and how do they relate these mediated- and real-life experiences to one another?
Hypotheses: not present
Methodology: This research took an inductive approach following grounded theory, conducting 10 in-depth semi-structured narrative interviews with self-proclaimed heterosexual young Dutch men aged 21 to 35. The interviews were analyzed using in vivo coding.
Findings_Summary: Most participants experienced mediated love stories as unrealistic/unrelatable due to their overly romantic, idealized, and heteronormative nature compared to their more toned-down, negative, and modern personal romantic experiences. For men with more positive personal romantic experiences, mediated love stories were experienced as more realistic/relatable. The majority rejected heteronormative portrayals, indicating that everyday experiences weigh more in shaping their romantic beliefs and behavior.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Research is conducted on the potential different experiences of older movies and more recent movies.', 'More research is conducted on specifically the dominant heterosexual courtship conventions.', 'This qualitative approach is replicated for women to gain insight in how women experience mediated love stories.']

Title: Sex Work, Power and Social Imaginary in the Netherlands (2023) – An old ‘problem’ with ‘new clothes’: How historically repeated narratives problematize sex work and the sex workers; a qualitative study.
Keywords: sex work, social imaginary, power, citizenship, vulnerability, otherness, dirtiness
Research_Goal: to investigate if the beliefs which derive from the institutions of the Christian religion and the gender stereotypes have historically affected the public narrations, the attitudes and the regulations that concern sex work in the Netherlands.
Research_Question: What are the major repeated patterns (and thus dominant narratives) which are reproduced within the Dutch social imaginary about sex workers since the 16th century and what possible impacts do they have on the sex workers?
Hypotheses: The institutions of power of religion and gender expectations correlate with one another and have a very specific social position for women.; Sex work deviates from the societal expectations of women, causing fear of structural disruption.
Methodology: This research is primarily a qualitative study, with data collected through interviews (N=10) and ethnographic observations within the Red-Light District, as well as the study of secondary data. The material was analyzed through the theories of Social Imaginary and Governmentality.
Findings_Summary: There were three major narratives which appear to derive from the two institutions of power (of religion and gender roles): the narrative of ‘vulnerability’, the narrative of ‘otherness’ and the narrative of ‘dirtiness’. These narratives negatively affect the status of the citizenship of the sex workers.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Further study is needed on the issue of sex work in the Netherlands as many different variables affect this topic.', 'The Dutch authorities should try to strengthen the voices of the sex workers in relation to sex work regulation.']

Title: Sliding Through Race: How Race is Enacted Using Skin-Colour Emojis
Keywords: skin-colour emojis, race, material-semiotics, identification, representation, subjectification
Research_Goal: to investigate how race is enacted in the everyday use of skin-colour emojis by users
Research_Question: How is race enacted in the everyday use of skin-colour emojis by users?
Hypotheses: not present
Methodology: The study employed a praxiographic approach, conducting 22 semi-structured interviews with participants in the Netherlands. The interviews included a scroll-back method where participants discussed their emoji choices in real-time, focusing on their practices and the meanings behind their choices.
Findings_Summary: The findings revealed that skin-colour emojis are used as proxies for race, with users justifying their choices based on notions of identification, representation, and relationality. The research showed that race and skin-colour are entangled concepts, and the design of emojis influences users' perceptions and practices.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Research that delves further into skin-colour as done through practices is necessary.', 'Future studies should include participants who use the fifth option as their actual colour.']

Title: Thesis Database - Information Extraction
Keywords: automated information extraction, master's theses, location extraction, organization extraction, educational field classification, methodology extraction
Research_Goal: to develop a method of automatically, accurately and efficiently extracting specific information from thesis texts
Research_Question: From a thesis, (full-text) what is a way to extract accurate information about the country/city it was written in, the institute in which it was written and its topic? How can we make sure that the extracted data is accurate?
Hypotheses: not present
Methodology: The study employed a Large Language Model (LLM) approach using OpenAI's GPT-4o-mini via API for information extraction. A purposive sample of 54 theses was selected for testing. The CRISP-DM methodology was used as a framework for the project.
Findings_Summary: The model performed reliably within the limited scope of the project and produced consistently structured outputs. However, further refinement is necessary in areas such as prompt engineering and validation methodology.
Future_Research_Suggestions: ['Building a scalable validation framework', 'Expanding to a more representative sample', 'Incorporating additional metadata to improve the utility and reliability of the extracted information', 'Automated topic mapping and institutional trend analysis']
